page.title: 13Boldron Village
page.content: Boldron Village used to be called {Bolt-hole,}because it was used as a refuge by highwaymen who had robbed coaches on the main road.(now the A66) Boldron used to be a hamlet with a few houses on one side of the green and was gradually extended during Georgian and Victorian times(and quite recently)to its present size. Its population is 87 people:64 adults (10 O.A.Ps.);23 children.Many of the residents are newcomers to the area. The village has a church,a chapel,and a public house/post office.The public telephone box acts as the local point of collection for newspapers. An annual fete is held on the village green,whilst the village hall is used every alternate fortnight for Women's Institute meetings and whist drives. The hall is also hired out for dances and discos.
